page.title: 16LANDSCAPE
page.content: Relief-This area is on lowland area and is situated round the Keer valley. The highest point is 118 metres and the lowest point is 11 metres.The area is dissected by the Keer valley.The flood plain at its widest point is 1 km wide.The valley is a mature river valley.The railway makes use of the river valley and traverses the flood plane on a dry site.Minor roads also aid communications linking the Capernwray area with Over-Kellet, Carnforth and Warton.This area is a rural area containing 3 villages Priest Hutton,Borwick and Capernwray. The first two, Borwick and Priest Hutton, are nucleated in structure, Capernwray being farmstead.Also this area is served by a railway station in Carnforth.The nearby amenities include a large hospital in Lancaster 6 miles south.
